main event: On July 3, 1949, approximately 150 witnesses reported seeing three yellow, disc-shaped objects in the sky over Longview, Washington.
interesting points: The observer, a naval commander and aeronautical engineer, confirmed the objects were not balloons, birds, common aircraft, or other typical objects., The objects moved in a 'skulking or falling leaf' motion and were metallic in color., The initial object was reported at an altitude of 30,000 feet and was visible for about three minutes., The sighting coincided with an air show where numerous credible witnesses were present., A second and third object were observed later, identified as identical to the first.
witness description: witnessed by a large group including airport engineers, pilots, police, and prominent citizens at the air show.
